meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of tragedy
meanings.sent1: The cothurnal atmosphere of the play made everyone feel somber.
meanings.sent2: Her cothurnal expression conveyed deep sorrow and grief.
meanings.sent3: The cothurnal theme of the party was unexpected but intriguing.
meanings.sent4: The cothurnal music echoed the melancholy of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The cothurnal setting was so realistic, it felt like stepping into a tragedy.

meanings.definition: a type of ancient Greek boot worn by tragic actors
meanings.sent1: The actors put on their cothurnals before going on stage.
meanings.sent2: The cothurnals added authenticity to the Greek tragedy performance.
meanings.sent3: He tripped over his cothurnals, causing a moment of comic relief.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the cothurnals clacking on the stage added to the dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the cothurnals made them stand out in the costume department.
